bibl.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In Justice Court, Seattle Precinct, King County, W.T.
Before N. Soderberg, Justice of the Peace
City of Seattle Plaintiff vs. Louis Brown Defendant
Territory of Washington County of King } ss. City of Seattle
To the Chief, or any Police Officer of the city of Seattle and the keeper of the jail of said City of Seattle:

Whereas, at a Justice Court held at my office in said County for the trial of Louis Brown for the offense herein stated, the said Louis Brown was convicted of having, on the 16 day of November, 1888, in said County and city committed the offense of Vagrancy and upon conviction, the said Court did
adjudge and determine that said Louis Brown should pay a fine of fifty dollars and be imprisoned in the City Jail of Seattle and work on the public streets for 15 days.
Whereas the said Louis Brown has made default in the payment of the same.

Therefore, you, the said Chief, or Police Officer, are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Louis Brown to the said Keeper and you, the said Keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said Louis Brown into your custody in said jail and him there keep at hard labor for the space of thirty days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid, or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
N. Soderberg Justice of the Peace
